definition: thick weeds/luxuriant growth/Illicium anisatum, a shrub with poisonous leaves/impertinent
official robe worn by ministers during the Ming 明 (1368-1644) and Qing 清 (1644-1911) dynasties

sentences.english: An anaconda in the Llanos of Venezuela.
sentences.chinese: 委內瑞拉大草原上的水蟒。

sentences.english: Eggs can be incubated by the female or artificially in an incubator.
sentences.chinese: 蛋可以由雌蟒或者人工用孵蛋器孵化。

sentences.english: I see you caught yourself a Reticulated Python.
sentences.chinese: 我見你抓到一隻網紋蟒。

sentences.english: A day's work at an Indonesian slaughterhouse yields a warehouse full of blood-python skins.
sentences.chinese: 印尼一家屠宰場一天生產滿滿一倉庫的血蟒皮。

sentences.english: The python loves water, swimming or lying in it to rest or to hunt.
sentences.chinese: 南非蟒習水，喜歡在水中游動覓食或靜臥於水中休息。
求偶的水蟒團成一個球。

sentences.english: Baby ball pythons will feed readily on half-grown mice.
sentences.chinese: 小球蟒願意喫半大老鼠。

sentences.english: while the man had also thrown in 14 royal pythons for good measure.
sentences.chinese: 而該男子還另外扔掉了14條球蟒。

sentences.english: Titanoboa, which measured up to 45 feet long, was the world's longest ever snake.
sentences.chinese: 泰坦蟒體長可達45英尺，是已知的世界上最長的蛇。

sentences.english: An albino Burmese python on display in Kuala Lumpur.
sentences.chinese: 一條緬甸蚺蟒白子在吉隆坡展出。

sentences.english: Burmese python during the molting Antifeedant.
sentences.chinese: 緬甸蟒在蛻皮期間會拒食。

definition: a legendary dragon with the ability to control rain and floods/see also 蛟龍|蛟龙[jiao1 long2]
